thread.title: Soccer: Red Bulls lock down regular-season title
thread.title_full: Soccer: Red Bulls lock down regular-season title

title: Soccer: Red Bulls lock down regular-season title
text:
Soccer: Red Bulls lock down regular-season title October 26, 2015 Last updated: Monday, October 26, 2015, 1:21 AM THE ASSOCIATED PRESS | Print 
Sacha Kljestan had a goal and an assist as the Red Bulls won the Supporters’ Shield as Major League Soccer’s regular-season champion with a 2-1 victory over the Chicago Fire on Sunday night in Bridgeview, Ill. 
The top-seeded Red Bulls (18-10-6) begin play in the Eastern Conference playoffs Sunday. They have a first-round bye. 
This is their second Supporters’ Shield in three seasons. They also snapped a 14-game winless streak at Toyota Park. 
The Red Bulls struck quickly in the eighth minute. Kljestan lofted his corner kick to Sal Zizzo, who headed the ball to Bradley Wright-Phillips. Wright-Phillips was left unmarked and he easily tapped in for his 17th goal of the season. 
NEW ENGLAND 3, NEW YORK CITY FC (at New York) — Charlie Davies had a goal and an assist and the Revolution clinched a playoff spot. 
Fifth-seeded New England (14-12-8, 50 points) snapped a four-game winless streak, and will travel to face fourth-seeded D.C. United (15-13-6, 51 points) in the knockout round Wednesday or Thursday. NYC FC (10-17-7, 37 points) ended its inaugural season with a three-game losing streak. © 2015 North Jersey Media Group Tags:
